home.intro: Hello — I am Ajim, a Chemical Engineering student with a passion for thermodynamics and biochemical engineering. I build models, conduct small-scale research, and travel to learn from industry practices. Edit this site by updating content.json in the repository.

items.details: Relevant coursework: Heat Transfer, Mass Transfer, Solution Thermodynamics, Multivariable Statistics.
Graduated with honors; focused on physics and chemistry.

items.title: Modeling Thermodynamic Behavior of PEG–Water–BSA Systems
items.summary: Developed excess Gibbs energy models to predict aqueous two-phase separation behavior for PEG–water–BSA mixtures. Implemented regression and visualization in Python; validated against experimental literature.

items.title: Sustainability Assessment of Solvent Recovery
items.summary: Performed process simulation and lifecycle assessment to identify energy-saving measures in solvent recovery for a small-scale plant.

items.title: Thermodynamics Modeler
items.subtitle: Excess Gibbs energy toolkit
items.description: A Python workbook and visualization set for fitting activity coefficients and generating phase diagrams for binary and ternary aqueous systems. Includes parameter estimation and plotting utilities.

items.title: Unit Ops Visualizer
items.subtitle: Shell & Tube diagram tools
items.description: Static site with annotated SVGs and calculators to help students understand shell-and-tube heat exchanger design and common failure modes.
